title: January 25
description:
Here's how the family's doing this week:

Felix lost toof number six. And he finally won his battle against a virus that's lasted two whole weeks. He had no appetite and lost a ton of weight, enough that his pants were slipping down. But now he's eating like a cochon again.

Milo has developed a deep, deep addiction to Spore (the video game Lucie's working for). We only let him play a little bit each day but he seems to prefer it to any other activity in the world right now. He's doing some very sophisticated things in it that take strategy and planning, so we guess it's educational on some level. However, we're suspicious of hooking him up to the computer at such an early age. We're developing a plan to wean him off.

Dean's company HOT or NOT launched an iPhone version of their website and it's in the top 5 social networking apps on iTunes. Woo!

Lucie had a lot of fun making icons for an upcoming suite of new Spore superpowers. Go Cosmic Blast!

Our good camera is in the shop with a "broken shutter magnet". Poor thing. This week's photos were all taken with Lucie's iPhone.

children.title: Connor
children.description:
Felix spent Friday night at schoolmate Connor's house. They stayed up late giggling and watching Star Wars Episode 6.

That's the good episode, with Ewoks.

children.title: Geo
children.description: It's the weekend, Benjamin's there, we're outside staring at a handheld device...

children.title: Geo 2
children.description: Yes yes, it's that geocaching craze that's bitten the Moses family like a rabid hamster.

children.title: Geo 3
children.description:
Benjamin the Boy Wonder spent the week on Google maps and geocaching.com plotting which caches to go to, and the exact route to take between them.

The route he chose was twisted like a pretzel, but we followed it faithfully.

children.title: Cachetop
children.description: This was a cool cache:  they fabricated a fake utility pipe with this businesslike cover.

children.title: Marble Run
children.description:
Addison & Parker's birthday party was held at the Lawrence Hall of Science.

Everybody made marble runs. Both the kids and the grownups had so much fun that the manager had to turn off the lights at the end to make people leave.
